definition: indirect, psychological method of getting sb to do as one wishes (e.g. questioning whether they are up to the task)
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: I provoked him into doing something really stupid.
sentences.chinese: 我用激将法使他做了件很蠢的事。

sentences.english: Such a "blindingly" general will not be any good results.
sentences.chinese: 这样的“激将法”一般不会有好效果。

sentences.english: He did it on a dare.
sentences.chinese: 他是在激将法的鼓动下做这件事的。

sentences.english: I dared him to jump from the bridge into the river.
sentences.chinese: 我用激将法要他从桥上跳入水中。

sentences.english: He jumped in the river at twelve o'clock last night for a dare.
sentences.chinese: 昨天夜里十二点，他在激将法的鼓动下跳进河里。

definition: to spur sb into action by making negative remarks
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
lit. to dispatch a general is not as effective as to excite a general/fig. inciting people to action is more effective than dispatching orders
pinyin: qing3 jiang4 bu4 ru2 ji1 jiang4

definition: delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
